alert.note: Alert for Phillips (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 17 at 2:45AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Phillips, southwestern Franklin, southeastern Furnas and Harlan Counties through 315 AM CDT... At 245 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Hollinger to Woodruff. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Alma, Oxford, Orleans, Stamford, Republican City, Long Island, Prairie View, Naponee, Bloomington, Huntley, Ragan, Hollinger, Woodruff and Harlan County Dam. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
